```{r}
#import 
library(palmerpenguins)# use penguin dataset to test the function 
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(testthat)
```

```{r}
group_summary<-function(x,y,na.rm=FALSE)
  if(!is.numeric(x) stop("Input is not numeric, object is of class",class(x)[1]) 
  if(!(y%in%penguins)stop("variable is not in the dataset",)) 
  group_by(y)
  result<-summarize(median=median(x))
  paste("By y, the mean of x is", result)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
